description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The country programme is effectively designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality standards in achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: In 2021 two evaluations were finalized with management responses and the office is on track with implementing the costed evaluation plan. Recommendations from the evaluations will inform the development of the new education sector plan in 2022.;;In collaboration with UNDP, UNICEF supported the Government in diagnosing the national evaluation capacities, including the action plan for evaluation capacity development for the period 2022-2023. Implementation of the action plan will strengthen national evaluation culture and increase the demand for evaluation at the Government level. Moreover, the office met the evaluation budget expenditure targets of 1 per cent of the programme budget.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/12/2021
